posts.author: scoobytoobins
posts.post_text: March 16, 2018 at 2:15 PM#3A lot of the time hitting the buttons 'MA + effect' will sync effects, or at least that's its intended purpose. Sometimes it doesn't work, though.Another way is to set up two executors with SpecialMasters for dimmer and P/T and assign your effect speeds to those. Then you can tap the learn button or play with your faders until they fall back in line.

posts.author: Duplicate Ryan Kanarek
posts.post_text: March 16, 2018 at 2:50 PM#4SyncEffects is only for effects that are running in the programmer. If it "doesn't work" then you're probably not running some/all of your effects in the programmer.

posts.author: Stereoface
posts.post_text: May 18, 2018 at 11:28 PM#5The best way to do this I've found is by defining a variable to a list of where your FX executors.Then turning them off and on. So that when you fire the macro all the fx start over.setvar $fxexecutors = "10.101 + 10.102 + 10.103"          (Wherever they are for you)Off Executor $fxexecutorsOn Executor $fxexecutors
